Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @Hollowman9000 all coinbases need to be shielded as part of the original Zcash protocol. that includes normal, smaller coinbases from both staking and mining.
@cryptoprofit.zone#5528 if you're not out of sync, you won't need to delete and resync. if you have the keys for the coins, it should be solvable. based on what you've said, it does seem that there is a likely issue of shielding/unshielding, but feel free to DM me for help. i'm deep in code/test/debug right now, but I will check in periodically

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Hollowman9000> So a mining/staking reward can be sent to a z address, and sent right back to the original address and then be valid for staking?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Hollowman9000> I won‚Äôt @ you, but thanks for the time mike

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Hollowman9000> _will no longer interrupt_

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03 (veruspool.xyz)> 'right back' wont work, it'll take a bunch

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03 (veruspool.xyz)> but basically, yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03 (veruspool.xyz)> you'd `z_shieldcoinbase` your coinbases (mining/staking rewards) and then `z_sendmany` back to one of your addresses.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03 (veruspool.xyz)> but it's only coinbases, the payouts from pool aren't coinbases, these are just normal transactions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ok88> Yes, just solo mined/staked blocks need shielding, pool shield the rewards for the users before sending (I guess? üòÉ ). If you run Agama in GUI, shielding is really easy with the "Shield all recent coinbase transactions" option and I recommend it for users that dislike putting cli commands up, it's really two mouseclicks.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03 (veruspool.xyz)> yea, the NOMP pools do the `z_shieldcoinbase` automagically after they find blocks. otherwise no payouts were possible.

Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> I'm totally with you I just wish that the institutions governing these new technologies would lay off and form new committees rather than using one's set up in the 1930s. With the blockchain and all this crap about net neutrality there really should be a new technology division formed. Why is it that we are all such unoriginal bastards that are afraid to pave new paths? We have to try to take new stuff and try to fit it in an ancient box. Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ok88> @GlorymanRTS I believe we are in accumulation phrase with price being in sideways advancement, you need to adjusts both the chart and coin supply rewards knowledge to understand that. It is good we have supply increase while moving sideways, really good price action for the project to not be supply driven.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ok88> @GlorymanRTS to ease the picture, please be aware that coins bought in Jul have staked a lot of coins for its holders, way more than ones you would aquire now did. The staked blocks were having more coins in it and the staking supply was way lower than now. That justifies the price action we had. If we are moving sideways while holders are acquiring more coins with staking, that means that demand is constantly rising, because it meets the constantly increasing supply. As long as price is the same, VRSC holders are gaining value because they stake more coins, so their portfolio value increases in BTC terms and VRSC terms. As long as we are having sideways price action we are actually gaining higher value of the project itself because basically its real market cap increases due to constantly rising supply ü§û

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <ver_User> @GlorymanRTS you are not wrong in principle, it has gone down since the listing. It also went up since the low at 0.0000099 - all depends on your framing ;)

there is so much wrong with using that chart like that without context. 

currently we are basically flatlining around 2, although creeping up a little. If the project demonstrates incremental successes and there is a good reception and uptake on cryptopia, then this should be a price floor. If not, honestly I don't know how low a bearish alt can go apart from 0. I don't want to make any guesses as I'm less familiar with early alt price behaviour, but I am generally thinking it'll take some months before we get readable/tradeable market moves. At the moment it's all about your preference, risk tolerance and personal intepretation of VRSC value. Personally I never like trend following as a starting point, so if one thinks it's bearish, it's time to consider buying IMO
